mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Walter Gibson Peter to unknown recipient, possibly 1862
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Peter, Walter Gibson, 1842-1863
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Writes while serving in the Civil War including descriptions of several horses, difficulty with his vision, mentions the battle of Munfordsville, speaks of 'the little sweet creature [unnamed] I am going to marry some of these days.' Trying to get the badge of honor but states, 'I have too much respect and feeling for my own person to allow a Yank to put a hole through me for any badge.' Mentions Orton [Williams] sends his best love. Signed 'Your ever devoted brother, Walter G. Peter.' Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
